greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n is of the form s^(2^e), where s is a squarefree number, and e >= 0, then a(n) is the (1+e)-th prime, otherwise a(n) = 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: If n is of the form s^(2^e), where s is a squarefree number, and e >= 0, then a(n) = A000040(1+e), otherwise a(n) = 1.
xref: Positions of terms > 1: A340682, of terms > 2: A340674.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 31 2021
